summary: The Rural Housing Service Reform Act of 2025 aims to reform rural housing programs. It addresses various aspects, including streamlining procedures, authorizing funding for staffing and IT upgrades, preserving rental assistance contracts, establishing a housing preservation program, creating a Native Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) relending program, modifying loan and grant eligibility, and establishing a rural housing voucher program. The bill also covers transfers to nonprofit organizations, extends loan terms, and addresses accessory dwelling units and the application review time frame.
